item.title: Project Insanity Methods
item.dc:creator: @tyyy9 tyyy9
item.description:
@tyyy9 wrote:

[quote=“SacredHeart, post:3, topic:407272”][quote author=escalation link=topic=508555.msg3689490#msg3689490 date=1312037374]
Startswith is like if a player types “::thesexsnjgahpsdguiduogsduin” It sees that it is starting with “Thesex” and it will activate the command.

IgnoreCase is where the command has to start with the command you imput.

[/quote]
[StartsWith] So if the command is ::Iamsosexy, and I type ::Iamso it will active at the command?

[EqualsIgnoreCase] I don’t quite understand.[/quote] No, he is saying that you wooud have to put somthing like ::Iamsosexydffjddf and because it starts with Iamsosexy it would work but it must have the whole command.

And [EqualsIgnoreCase] i think he is saying that you have to input the exact code for it to work

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity Methods
item.dc:creator: @escalation escalation
item.description:
@escalation wrote:

[quote=“SacredHeart, post:3, topic:407272”][quote author=escalation link=topic=508555.msg3689490#msg3689490 date=1312037374]
Startswith is like if a player types “::thesexsnjgahpsdguiduogsduin” It sees that it is starting with “Thesex” and it will activate the command.

IgnoreCase is where the command has to start with the command you imput.

[/quote]
[StartsWith] So if the command is ::Iamsosexy, and I type ::Iamso it will active at the command?

[EqualsIgnoreCase] I don’t quite understand.[/quote]

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("Thesex")) {
sM("I am the sexy");
}

^^ thats the ignore case:

Player types ::thesex (nothing happens) Player types ::Thesex (command activates)

if (playerCommand.startsWith("Thesex")) {
sM("I am the sexy");
}

^^ thats the starts with command.

Player types ::these(nothing happens) Player types ::thesex 123 (command activates because it starts with TheSex.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity Methods
item.dc:creator: @SacredHeart SacredHeart
item.description:
@SacredHeart wrote:

I haven’t ever seen a topic asking what the difference is between the two, can anybody care to explain to enhance my java knowlege.

What’s the difference with equalsIgnoreCase and startsWith?

Example.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("Thesex")) { sM("I am the sexy"); }

if (playerCommand.startsWith("Thesex")) { sM("I am the sexy"); }

I’ve experimented with them and I don’t see the difference.

Read full topic
